paper_metadata.title: Land consolidation (LC) has increasingly been recognized as a key policy instrument for advancing rural revitalization in post-poverty China

program_information.target_population: Rural villages in resource-constrained mountainous regions

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: using the DID model to assess the multidimensional impacts of LC on economic development, income generation, social governance, and ecological restoration, and to deconstruct the mechanisms through which LC drives RCDC
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: we employ a continuous difference-in-differences model and an event study method to examine the multidimensional impacts of LC

bonus_information.cost_mentions: RMB 1 billion investment impact on RCDC
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: Regression estimates suggest that each additional RMB 1 billion invested in LC projects is associated with an increase of about 12 percent in RCDC

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Land consolidation (LC) has increasingly been recognized as a key policy instrument for advancing rural revitalization in post-poverty China
evidence_citations.country_citation: Drawing on high-resolution remote sensing data and panel data from Fuping County spanning 2014 to 2023
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: In China's resource-constrained mountainous regions, rural development capacity remains limited due to the intersecting challenges of geographic marginalization, resource scarcity, and ecological vulnerability
